message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.ST

This paper deals with the problem of multi-armed bandits, which is a classic problem in machine learning and optimization. The paper focuses on the case where the number of arms is large but finite, which is a common scenario in many real-world applications. The paper provides a complete analysis of expected regret in a Bayesian setting, which is a fundamental measure of performance in multi-armed bandits. The paper also proposes optimal and greedy algorithms for this problem, and provides empirical evidence to support their effectiveness. Overall, the paper is likely to be relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), information theory (cs.IT), and statistics (cs.ST).
